result.execSummary:
The defendant George M Capriotti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of Extended Supervision shall remain the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
---------------------------------

No contact with John Krubert, Kurt Bullis or D.P.  Not to possess or consume alcohol or illegal drugs. Not to possess drug paraphernalia.
---------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------------

timeConds.notes: in the Walworth County Jail to commence on 11/29/2016.

supervisions.notes: If the defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of Extended Supervision shall remain the same as the conditions of probation.

Letter regarding payment plan balance
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Temporary Commitment form filed
BOND QUASHED

9:00 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DDA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant George M Capriotti in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing hearing.  Court recites charges and maximum potential penalties.  State will be recommending prison but will not make a specific recommendation as to length of sentence.   Court has reviewed the PSI.  
Atty Lettenberger has reviewed the PSI with his client and does not have any additions or corrections.  
9:02 am  Statement by Mr. Steven Fritsch on behalf of defendant.  
9:07 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Johnson.  
9:12 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Lettenberger.  
9:28 am  Statement by Defendant.  
9:32 am  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing Mr. Capriotti.    

SENTENCE:  
Ct 1:  6 years Prison:  4 yrs IC followed by 2 yrs ES;  
Ct 2:  6 years Prison:  4 yrs IC followed by 2 yrs ES, conc w/Ct 1;  
Above sentences are IMPOSED AND STAYED;  
Thirty (30) days sentence credit if probation is revoked.  

Four (4) years probation;  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Six (6) months in WCJ with work release to commence on 11/29/2016;  
1)  No contact with John Krubert, Kurt Bullis or D.P.  
2)  Not to possess or consume alcohol or illegal drugs.  Not to possess drug paraphernalia.  
3)  Obtain AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.  
4)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
5)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
6)  Continue with full time employment.  

Court warns defendant 1) He may not possess firearms;  2) He cannot vote until his civil rights are restored; 
9:52 am  Court in recess.
Notice of Self-Imposed Disqualification
Sentencing hearing on November 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant George M Capriotti in court with attorney Anthony Flitcroft.  Cody John Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Minutes Filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Signed bond filed with the court.

AMENDMENT 8-6-2015 - NO CONTACT WITH CI1049 OR HIS/HER RESIDENCE.

MUST BE CO-SIGNED BY ELIZABETH JOHN
MUST POST $1,000.00 CASH. 
Defendant may reside at Mt. Zion House. He may reside with his mother for not more than 5 days prior to entry into Mt. Zion House to accomplish the prerequisites to admission, Defendant's mother (the co-signer) is to inform the court if the Defendant is not successful and is discharged from the program. 
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.K.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
